text: minting ginger and garlic can be quite a
pain especially if you don't have the
knife skills maybe your ginger and
garlic comes out more chops than minced
well I'm gonna show you a really simple
trick use a microplane
to mince your ginger and garlic it's
super simple and it's kind of fun so an
easy way to break up the head of garlic
is to just put your palm on top put your
weight into it you can kind of hear it
it separates and it should fall apart
just like this and I'm gonna use one
clove peel it just by cutting off the
root end and peeling back all of that
papery
exterior take the microplane and to just
grate the garlic you can grade it over a
plate you can grade it right into the
pan it's really really fast and what you
end up with is a perfect uniform cut of
garlic and then for ginger take a sharp
sided spoon and just peel the papery
skin away it's so fast and easy if you
haven't peeled ginger like this before
you should try it so once you have it
peeled again same technique microplane
and give it a really good great you have
to apply a little bit more pressure here
because ginger is really fibrous but as
you can see it's so fast I like to just
use it in a vinaigrette for a salad tap
it right into a jar with lime juice
a little bit of safflower oil salt and
pepper give it a good shake and just
drizzle it over your favorite greens and
you have a simple salad for your dinner
and with garlic a saute of spinach a
little bit of olive oil into a hot pan
tap out the garlic
and just add the baby spinach right on
top you'll really get the flavor of the
garlic's it's so nice and fine and that
literally only took two minutes there
you have it two easy ways to mince your
ginger and your garlic without a board
or a knife
